author.company_position: Supervisor/Team Lead of Frontend Web Development

speakers.company: Division of Information Technology at University of Wisconsin-Madison

content.raw: April Ebacher is a front-end web development team lead at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. She has over a decade of experience building rich internet applications utilizing and evangelizing for accessibility, usability, industry standards and best practices throughout the development life cycle. She has spent the last 4-5 years in academia, contributing to and assisting in the campus WordPress community.

content.raw: Cathy Riley is the Project Manager for the WordPress Service at UW Madison.
content.rendered: Cathy Riley is the Project Manager for the WordPress Service at UW Madison.

content.raw:
Change is hard! Especially when a service team is asking hundreds of individuals and departments to totally reconfigure how they’re adding, updating and maintaining content on their websites—all while transforming their own processes, workflows and underlying infrastructure and technologies. That's exactly what happened to us during our OpenText to WordPress migration. We will walk through our journey, highlight accomplishments and share lessons learned and how we continue to modify our processes with agile methodologies.

What attendees can hope to learn:

  • How important clear communication and thoughtful planning are in any sort of change.
  • Strategies to incorporate change into your workflow processes.
  • Continuous integration isn’t just a development thing.
